PONIES AND RIDING ON SCORAIG
NINE PEOPLE ON SCORAIG BETWEEN THEM OWN 15 PONIES.THE BREEDS ARE HIGHLAND EXMOOR,ICELANDIC,SHETLAND AND WELSH COB.THE PONIES ARE USED MOSTLY FOR RIDING,ESPECIALLY BY CHILDREN,BUT ALSO FOR CARRYING THINGS UP FROM THE SHORE OR BRINGING PEAT DOWN FROM THE HILL. THE ROUGH TERRAIN IS NOT IDEAL FOR PONIES. THERE IS ONE BREEDER OF PONIES ON SCORAIG.SHE HAS A SMALL HERD OF EXMOORS,INCLUDING A STALLION.WHEN THE PONIES ARE OLD ENOUGH SHE BRAEKS THEM IN FOR RIDING. THERE IS PLENTY OF GRAZING ON SCORAIG DURING THE SUMMER TIME AND IN THE WINTER THE PONIES ARE GIVEN A LITTLE HAY AND CONCENTRATES.THEY ARE RARELY STABLED INSIDE.
